meanings.definition: To die through submersion in and inhalation of water.
meanings.sent1: The poor man drowned in the deep river.
meanings.sent2: The sailor drowned in the stormy sea.
meanings.sent3: The fish thought it was funny that the worm drowned in the puddle.
meanings.sent4: Her sorrows drowned her like a raging ocean.
meanings.sent5: The memories of that day drowned him in regret.

meanings.definition: To overwhelm with a large amount of something.
meanings.sent1: She drowned in paperwork at the office.
meanings.sent2: The town drowned in a sea of colorful flowers during the festival.
meanings.sent3: The kids were delighted to drown their pancakes in syrup.
meanings.sent4: The loud music drowned out all other sounds in the room.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of fresh bread drowned the bakery in warmth.

meanings.definition: To be covered or flooded with a liquid.
meanings.sent1: The streets drowned in heavy rain during the storm.
meanings.sent2: The garden drowned in sunlight on a bright summer day.
meanings.sent3: The cake was almost ruined when the icing drowned the top layer.
meanings.sent4: Her voice drowned in the noise of the bustling city.
meanings.sent5: The room drowned in darkness as the lights went out.
